Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: small, but very nice! good service, very nice rooms, toilet and bath clean, top situated. I'm looking forward to coming soon again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Stag in The Dam”
Reviews.Author: graeme11
Reviews.Content: great value for money,rooms spot less, great staff who were very helpful.We didnt make breakfast so cant comment on that though again Manager told us where to get excellent Irish breakfast that sorted the boys out for the day.Only drawback for me being lazy was room was on 4th floor!!! Get one lower down stairs are like ladders

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young people”
Reviews.Author: nantia
Reviews.Content: Nice atmoshphere, kind and friendly stuff , beautiful decoration and excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, safe, great value and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DavieDouble
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends on my stag trip. Perfect hotel for a stag or group trip. Free WiFi, very friendly and welcoming staff, good bar with live music and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. Nice rainforest shower too!

Reviews.Title: “The place is nice but all credit goes to the staff which made it really wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ManavShital
Reviews.Content: The place is perfect placed as all the places are really close you can say its like 2 to 3 minutes walking to clubs, the museums and everything. The rooms are basic and nice. The staff was really helpful with all our demands which we Indian normally overdo. They helped us giving all the details which helped us to get the best places and spot for the Parade which was really amazing. We would recommend this place to all those young couples or group of friends out there.

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodation in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 187dashizzle187
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam a few times in recent years and if you're looking for somewhere affordable, in a good location and clean then this is the place for you. I will say now there are very steep steps, so if that's a problem please don't book, but everything else is pretty much perfect. The staff are very friendly and helpful (let us leave bags on day of departure and arrival until room was ready). The cost is the same per person as a dirty hostel in the red light district, but instead of a stained mattress crammed into a rat-infested hole you get a spacious double bed, cool music-themed furniture including ipod speakers and clean sheets. Some people have complained about noise but the windows are good quality so I didn't have any problems with trams outside. The location is about 15 minute walk from the RLD and centre, but there are many restaurants and shops in the local area (including coffee shops). The hotel is also close to the Van Gogh and Rembrandt museums, the Heineken Experience and Anne Frank house, as well as canal boat tour points. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Good location & concept”
Reviews.Author: nysacik
Reviews.Content: we were in the hotel for the weekend, and we were really happy with how close it is to bars/clubs (like 3 mins walk from Melkweg). the concept is very cool and even the most basic rooms are with the decorative items like drum lamps and the make up mirror. i would recommend for any group of friends travelling there!

Reviews.Title: “Girls from England.”
Reviews.Author: becky b
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 other girls for a girly weekend! We thought it was brilliant. Great location, very near pubs, cafe's, resturants and clubs. Lovely at xmas time too! Comfy beds and spacious rooms! The only downside is that ther stairs are very steep, not good in high heels!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for student group or young budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: gr8ful47
Reviews.Content: My college student group stayed here in June 2010 and I was extremely happy with BackStage. The guy at the front desk could not have been more awesome and helpful. If I ran a hotel I would hire him in a heartbeat. The breakfast buffet was nicely done. The students were impressed that the management lets you play the musical instruments on the walls. The place is filled with cool rock and roll art and mementos. Rooms are fine and great value. And location is excellent, on a canal a block off Leidseplein with shops, restaurants, bars. Five minute short walk to Museumplein. Best value I have found for student group, great location and service. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: kjesse
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location near a lot of bars, restaurants, and shops. As other reviewers have indicated, beware of the stairs here! They are steep and small, making them extremely hard to navigate with bags. However, once we arrived at it, our room was clean and bigger than in other budget hotels we stayed in in Europe. The staff was friendly and helpful, and overall we had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff & great theme!”
Reviews.Author: soccermom1965
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. The breakfast in the morning was also worth the extra money and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: hzxaa
Reviews.Content: The only positive at Backstage Hotel Amsterdam was its location (it's just a short walk from Leidseplein, the square with the bars). But location in Amsterdam is a relative thing, as we discovered after renting bikes; you can easily move around the city with them: fast, cheap, green and fun way to discover the city. Unforunatley, I can't say anything positive other then that about this hostel-like hotel. The bathroom door was broken, the floor looked really dirty and used, as the rest of place. Wouldn't stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. It should be renamed a "Hostel" not a "Hotel".”
Reviews.Author: Roaming12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single occupancy room in July 2011. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in. Just enough room for a small bed, a small wash basin and stool. The bed was short and sunk in the middle which meant I had a very uncomfortable night's sleep. Adding to this, the "Hotel" is in a busy part of town near a fairly major road with alot of traffic and pedestrians at all hours. The walls are thin and you can hear the comings and goings of the other guests throughout the night. The toilet and showers were shared and located in the hall and were extremely small - it was difficult to fit inside and close the door! The shower and toilet did not appear particularly clean either. The building itself is old and the interior has a very "knocked around" feel about it. More like a very average hostel rather than a Hotel. Except they charge high hotel rates! The one redeeming feature is the "Hotel's" location. Easy walking distance to most touristy places in Amsterdam. I didn't need to take trams, I walked everywhere. Nevertheless, there are hundreds of hotels in Amsterdam, many with good, if not better, locations. I would not recommend this hotel to family and friends. Even if you are happy to stay in hostel style accommodation, go elsewhere to get a better rate. This place is very overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: franciscafh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus two friends of ours (a couple) stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The rooms are really stylish w/comfortable beds and clean bathrooms. Our room was on the second floor which was OK but unfortunately our friends room was on the basement which was a little noisy. The hotel staff is really nice and helpful. The location is great, next to all the big attractions of the city, 2 minutes walking distance from Leidsplein Square. Definitely a great choice when visiting Amsterdam. Ps. If needed, do book a taxi in advance (the hotel staff will do this for you) for picking up.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I found this place... A fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Antonia J
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam to visit friends, and see a band perform at the nearby Melkweg venue. We could not have chosen a better hotel. The location was perfect for our needs, being a 2 minute walk from the venue, and very close to bars, restaurants and sights. The staff were very friendly and always happy to help. The bar area was the best I saw while in Amsterdam, and our friends who were staying in other hotels often came to enjoy drinks with us before we went out. (Our friends wished they were staying there too, instead of their fancy hotels on the outskirts of town.) The decor definitely fits the place well, and the staff are happy for you to play the guitars and the piano (at reasonable times). Although we did not have breakfast, it looked tasty! The rooms were quite small which is typical in Amsterdam due to the shape of the buildings, but everything you needed was there. The room was very clean, the bed was comfy and the interesting furniture and fixtures surely made the place special. The bathrooms were clean and although I would normally request an en-suite room, there was no need as the facilities were fine. The whole place was great, everywhere including the bar, corridors, stairs and rooms were always cleaned. Only down-side was being woken up early in the morning by the cleaners, as the walls are a little thin, but at least you know the place is clean!! It was worth the money! I did a lot of research before we went, and basic hostels were the same price as this hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, there was a great mix of people of all ages and nationalities staying here, and everyone enjoyed the atmosphere together.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for one night if only for the music experience.”
Reviews.Author: Skarlett123
Reviews.Content: Our kids are both into music so it seemed the right place to stay. We had read about those stairs and everything is true. They are exceptionally steep and not good for large heavy luggage, but we knew this before we booked. Room with 2 double beds suited our needs well. Bathroom looking a little tired, some fixtures broken and needs some TLC. Decor is funky with the use of instruments and music gear. Bar was great to come back to at the end of the day. Walk into the main square 10 to 15 minutes. Heaps of canals to stroll around and streets plentiful with restaurants nearby. Service was always friendly and the fruit And licorice on the front desk a winner. We did not find that the tram noise bothered us at all. I would recommend you take a torch to stay as the lighting in the rooms is plentiful, but the wattage in the bulbs really low. We were doing holiday homework by torchlight and that was with all of the lights on at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel within walking distance of dt Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mowi82
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel but has everything you need for a big city visit. It is probably more like a hostel than a hotel but it is very nice and clean. As the name indicates, it is inspired by musicians so most of the interior is made from boxes that bands on tour keep there gear in. There is a bar with a pool table in the entrance and nice staff who both serves you drinks in the bar and check you in and out.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world - like going home!”
Reviews.Author: Elyn1981
Reviews.Content: I've visited Amsterdam nearly 20 times in the last few years, and this is the ONLY hotel i stay at. If you're looking for friendly staff, awesome perks, great location, and lots of licorice candy, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: janinabee
Reviews.Content: To start off with we requested a room on the lower floors but when we arrived they had no record of this and the only room available was on the 4th floor. Those stairs! Then the trams rambled past the hotel until the small hours of the morning and they rattled the window so badly we couldn't sleep. While the room itself was clean and comfortable, the bathroom needed a good clean. The location is pretty good and most things are in walking distance. Great place to spot a famous musician or two.

Reviews.Title: “Backstage Hotel - Good value, comfortable rooms and great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Schmallenable
Reviews.Content: The Backstage Hotel is located within walking distance of most attractions in Amsterdam. Only a 15 minute walk away from the Anne Frank House and the Van Gogh Museum. The rooms are clean and comfortable. They are also decorated with 'backstage' themed items, such as a snare drum ceiling light. Our room was located on the fourth floor and it was a bit of a struggle to get our luggage up and down the stairs, as there are no elevators. The hotel is good value for money and suitable for young travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not interesting”
Reviews.Author: frdleroux
Reviews.Content: It seemed to be a good idea as we considered the previous comments. In reality, we paid the first night 75â‚¬ for a 16mÂ² room with shared bath-room (and we didn't care about sharing the facilities). But the second and third nights, we were overcharged for 25â‚¬ per night, so 100â‚¬ per night for the same kind of room, 3 higher floor., and not bigger. Considering the difficulty of "climbing" the dutch stairs, it shouldn't be an overcharge, but a discount that we should have. We missed the only "concert" as we were not informed about the representation. And the recommandation about other place where to hear music were wrong as the places were closed... As I see in the other comments, discuss the rates the lower you can as nobody should pay more than 70/75â‚¬ for a room in this hotel. Some other hotel in the city offer lower rates for the same kind of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “No regret but happy !”
Reviews.Author: Listechie
Reviews.Content: We got here i think 3 weeks ago and were welcomed by very freidnly staff. Location is perfect with a view of the canal. The room was quite small but good enough if considering the rate that the hotel is charging us. The breakfast was more than I expected, really tasty ! They served drinks in the bar 24h, impressive ! (especially for yound traveller) And only a short cab will take you to the red light district So no complains and regret at all for this place. Although i will advice to confirm the booking with them in advance.

Reviews.Title: “A little out the way and expensive but its a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: davexr2i
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about a 20 minute wall from the main square but right next door the van gough museum. Quite expensive place to stay but rooms are clean and nicely decked out with the music theme. The hotel has no lifts and the stairs are almost vertical!! Had a few problems when we first got there i.e the bed being broke, however they did change it (the next day!). Would stay a little bit closer to dam square next time but overall the hotel is fine for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel - Bathroom Stunk!”
Reviews.Author: BCollyer
Reviews.Content: We got to Amsterdam late and had to take this hotel. Room was very interesting but bathroom plumbing stunk. Must have had a vent problem. The room was expensive but comfortable. Narrow (typical for the city) winding stairs that simply wore us out going up and down. Staff was very helpful. Only stayed one night but it served its purpose. Not a bad experience but stay was too short to provide a detailed review.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming friendly and fun”
Reviews.Author: jamesmode
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one whole year here whilst working under contract nearby and the owner and his staff could not have done more to assist and serve me well from the very start. There was never once a time I felt overlooked or ignored. The building is smart and also kept very clean. Any problem was resolved quickly. When I needed sleep and there was noise outside they offered earplugs ! The jazz and popular music theme is great fun. I would always stay here whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “The best 2-star hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Momof2Paris_Boston
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff, Guitar Hero and pool in the open area (not to mention the bar...) and nice to children. My two thought the room was super cool, my aspiring actress (11 years old) loved the lighted mirror. We walked to the Anne Frank House and several parks and restaurants. The transport is very close, and even though it was a holiday weekend, we had no trouble with noise or other guests. It was the kind of place I would liked to have stayed in my 20's, and it was also great for me at 45 with 2 kids (and don't worry, we only played pool and guitar hero in the late afternoon/early evening, so older guests don't have to hang out with children. Canal views, safe feeling. And did I say CLEAN? Our room was great! I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Rock til you drop!”
Reviews.Author: rosco2212
Reviews.Content: This place was class. The staff were great, amazingly friendly and helped out in anyway possible. Great location, close to some beautiful sites and only 15mins walk to Dam Square. I would recommend this place to anyone who is up for partyin hard and taking in Amsterdams beautiful scenery! MUCH LOVE, Rosco x

Reviews.Title: “No need to look anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsRob
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great customer service and a great location near Leidseplein. My wife and I stayed one night with three teenage boys (13-15 years old) and loved it. Got a quad on the third floor with built in Guitar Hero and DJ Hero. Room also had an IPOD docking station and flat screen plasma TV. Didn't plan on spending much time in the room during our Amsterdam stay but could hardly get the boys out! The room was also decorated in rock band style. The staff were super friendly. Only down side was the noise from the trams right outside but they stop at a decent hour and you can always get earplugs from the reception desk. Recommend this hotel highly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MrBeefy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Backstage Hotel and it was awesome!!!!! I will never stay anywhere else when in Amsterdam. We had a 4 person suite that was the envy of all our friends staying at other hotels in the area. It was HUGE compared to other rooms I have stayed in whilst traveling in Amsterdam. Our room also had an xbox360 with guitar hero and dj hero hooked up to one of the two flat screens. The beds where very comfortable and the hotel was always clean. The staff was incredible and such very friendly people. They really helped make our experience such a good one. I can't wait to get back . Thank you Backstage Hotel for everything.

Reviews.Title: “They should have these in every city for budget travel!”
Reviews.Author: bint86
Reviews.Content: The staff here were really friendly and helpful. We managed to lock ourselves out of our room and they dealt with it straight away. On our second day the hot water in our room went off, it turned out to be a problem with the pressure in the street and without any fuss they opened up another room for us to use the shower. On the last day they also let us leave our luggage there after we had checked out and nothing went missing - always a bonus! I stayed here for 2 nights with my boyfriend and another couple in a quadruple room on the 4th floor - there is no lift but after the first climb you don't notice it and there was a nice view of the canal when you got there. From what I could tell, all the rooms would have views onto the street and canal as the hotel is on the corner. The room was really funky and looks exactly like it does in the pictures on the website! The staff pointed is in the direction of a mini supermarket and it was exactly as they said, a few minutes round the corner. There are bars a few hundred metres away open till 2-3am but there is no noise or disruption at the hotel as there weren't rowdy but more chilled with many friendly locals. The central station is about a 25-30 min walk but the trams go everywhere and you can get one 500m or so from the hotel. There is a square close by the tram stop with pubs and food places, when we were there an outdoor mini ice rink was also open. Best = the cool, clean rooms with nice views in a good location for the price. Worst = The hotel hadn't been around that long when we stayed there so it's full potential of bustling residents hadn't been reached - good excuse to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, pleasant and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: LambyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Funky place stayed for a gig at the Paradiso, I would only stay with an ensuite room, not keen on sharing facilities, however our room was nice and beds were comfy room warm but freezing in the ensuite, but then it is winter. Staff very nice and friendly, helpful even when we checked out making sure our flight was not delayed. Also gave info on getting back to the airport rather than getting a tram and train, get the bus from outside the American hotel straight to the Airport for 3 euros each and it takes about 25/30 min. Cheaper and less hassle. Really enjoyed my stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Muso or not, a great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: brisoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is aimed at bands passing through Amsterdam but even if you are not in a band its still a great place to stay. I have stayed in every flea infested band hotels all over Europe so i never expected this!! All the rooms are made up of musical bits and pices like a snare drum light shade, flight case bed and wardrobes, drum stools for seat's. plus the rooms all have plasma t.v's and ipod docking stations!. the bar stays open all nite which was a plus, th only problem being that they kept running out of ice. The breakfast in the morning was great, everything you could want was laid out befour you. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel itself and the location gives you very much the 'Amsterdam feeling"”
Reviews.Author: amazone76
Reviews.Content: Born and raised in Amsterdam but now living abroad I know where one should be to able to make the most of even a short stay in this great city. From Backstage Hotel anything you would like to see is in a walking distance. The Leidseplein (with things to do day and night), the Vondelpark, streets to shop, museums, the canals with houses of many centuries ago, architecture and much more. But also stations for trams and busses wich can take you to other neighbourhoods of the city. Also, from the airport busses go regularly to take you to the Leidseplein (5 minutes from Backstage) in about half an hour. The hotel itself is great, nice people, quiet surroundings (yes one will hear people walking by, the tram etc. but that's part of 'living' the city. Hope you will have as much of a nice time as I had!! (Î“Î¹Î± Ï„Î¿Ï…Ï‚ ÎˆÎ»Î»Î·Î½ÎµÏ‚, ÎµÎ¯Î¼Î±Î¹ ÎŸÎ»Î»Î±Î½Î´Î­Î¶Î± Î±Ï€ÏŒ Ï„Î¿ Î†Î¼ÏƒÏ„ÎµÏ�Î½Ï„Î±Î¼ Î±Î»Î»Î¬ Î¼Î­Î½Ï‰ ÏƒÏ„Î·Î½ ÎšÏ�Î®Ï„Î·. Î¤Î¿ Backstage ÎµÎ¯Î½Î±Î¹ Ï€Î¿Î»Î»Î® ÎºÎ±Î»Î® ÎµÏ€Î¹Î»Î¿Î³Î® ÏŒÏ„Î±Î½ Î¸Î­Î»ÎµÎ¹Ï‚ Î½Î± Î¶ÎµÎ¯Ï‚ Î»Î¯Î³Î¿ Ï„Î·Î½ ÎºÎ¿Ï…Î»Ï„Î¿Ï�Ï�Î± Ï„Î·Ï‚ Ï€Î¿Î»Î®Ï‚!) Andrea (age, 44)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for musicians and others as well......very reasonable and good location.”
Reviews.Author: 9999Nashville_tn_
Reviews.Content: We were treated to very nice service at all hours of the night.And yes the bar is open 24hrs! The breakfast was more than I expected and there is a nice nook with a view of the canal. Its a great location as far as sightseeing,shopping and nightlife.The red light district and train station are only a short cab or trolly ride away. Ask for Hans.He gave us a great rate. Thanks again Backstage.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay. Great, friendly staff! Clean room”
Reviews.Author: Damrocks
Reviews.Content: Easy to find. Very friendly and helpful staff. We travelled with our 1 yr old and they were very accomodating. The bathroom was the only neg. It was shared. The toilet was one tiny room and the shower was a different room down the hall. Beware of door being unlocked but someone being in the shower. It was clean though. There wasn't air conditioning at the time we went but nights got fairly cool. The bedroom was clean. Hotel was pretty quiet except for our crying baby-oops! (We were the only ones staying with a child.) The location was awesome -rent bikes! You will definitely want to tour with bikes. The internet use was great to stay in touch with our family. Overall this hotel was a great fit and mid-budget for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The best bed, and location”
Reviews.Author: rainSpott
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing hostel i've been. Me and 4 friends stayed in a room of 5 and it had the best beds. Space enought for what we expected, we all loved the decor, the heiniken welcome pack, the view from our window to the canal... Only the stairs were quite a challenge when we return at late hours. But we recommend this place to everyone, great location, not in the center and therefore quite but close to one of the main nightlife places. The staff are 5 stars, really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family with Teens”
Reviews.Author: KSaenz
Reviews.Content: Traveling in Europe with 3 boys, all over 6', and with huge appetites can be expensive! This place was a great find! We were all able to sleep in ONE room, we all had beds and there was still pace to walk in the room! Musical stuff every where -- very fun! Staff was super and very helpful. Located on a canal and within walking distance to various kinds of transportation. Breakfast had a great variety and filled the boys. Parking was located a bit away, but my husband and son were given bicycles that they rode back to the hotel. It was a positive experience for them. Over all a great place to stay! Only negative -- this is supposed to be a nonsmoking hotel, but I think there was people smoking in their rooms because we could smell it, we just couldn't pin point the location. It would be nice if the staff were more vigilant where this is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to crash”
Reviews.Author: roczberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the backstage for a weekend in Amsterdam and the location is excellent. Its right next to Leideseplein, and you can reach the clubs and museums within mins. The staff was helpful, and use of the computer was free in the lobby. The bathrooms were shared, which is annoying, but the twin room was a good size with a flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “my spiritual home”
Reviews.Author: 40isgr8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Backstage with two friends to celebrate our 40th birthdays, we are all mums travelling on a budget who expect a nice clean room and bedding, we got that plus more. the staff were great, very friendly and helpful, and the rooms and rest of the hotel were perfectly clean, and a brilliant central position.

Reviews.Title: “BackStage Hotel Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Smoolander
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a three nights stay here in June, and we booked it on the strength of the room style. The instructions on how to get to the hotel from the airport were very good, and the hotel is located very close to the Leidseplein. The hotel itself is a very typical Dutch house in Amsterdam, tall and narrow. Check in was very easy, as most people in Amsterdam speak very good English, and we were given a room on the 4th floor. The only bad thing about this is that there is no lift at the hotel and the stairs are narrow and steep, so it is not a good prospect for those who struggle with heavy luggage. The decor of the room is superb, everything from the drum kit light, to the drummer chair, and rockstar table with lights. Not only that, but there is an iPod radio alarm clock in the room, and all rooms have free Wi-Fi access (just ask for the login details at reception). The room itself is not that big, but if you are only using it for sleeping before seeing and partaking in the sights of Amsterdam then it is quite good. This is a hotel that my wife and I would recommend to anyone wishing to stay in a modern, yet different hotel, in Amsterdam in a quality location.

HotelInfo.Name: BackStage Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsegracht 114, Amsterdam 1016 CT, The Netherlands
